revised_title: A New Perspective on Light and Colors: Young's Undulatory Theory
tldr: In this lecture, Thomas Young presents a new theory of light and colors, proposing that light is made up of undulations in the luminiferous ether. He explains how the sensation of different colors depends on the frequency of these vibrations in the retina. Young's theory also accounts for phenomena such as refraction, reflection, and dispersion of colors, providing a more comprehensive understanding of light and its properties.
